titleInfo.title: Marguerite Martin and her daughter talk about their performances at Marguerite's senior center, 2007 October 06

physicalDescription.note: Excerpted from: NPL000026 original StoryCorps interview edited by Aimee James in December 2008.

location.physicalLocation: Special Collections Division of the Nashville Public Library, 615 Church Street, Nashville, Tennessee, 37219

mods.abstract: An edited excerpt with transcript and photograph from an interview with Marguerite Martin, conducted on 6 October 2007 by her daughter Sarah McConnell at the Nashville StoryCorps StoryBooth, located in the Nashville Room of the Nashville Public Library. Marguerite and Sarah talk about the tap dance and singing routine they perform at Marguerite's senior center and the Music for Seniors project that Sarah started to bring entertainers to Nashville's senior centers. During the interview, they perform the song "School Days (When We Were A Couple of Kids)." The complete, un-edited interview, as well as an index, is available in the Special Collections Division. These interviews were recorded by StoryCorps at the Nashville Public Library with the support of the Nashville Public Library Foundation and are provided courtesy of StoryCorps, a national initiative of Sound Portraits Productions to record and collect oral history interviews. www.storycorps.net
